title: b'APOCNG 2022'
description: b'Nuclear Ghosts (Special Issue) - Apocalyptica'
Categories: b'nuclear humanities' b'haunting' b'cultural studies' b'nuclear colonialism'
Call For Papers: b'\nApocalyptica is an international, interdisciplinary, open-access, double-blind peer-reviewed academic journal published by the K\xc3\xa4te Hamburger Centre for Apocalyptic and Post-Apocalyptic Studies (CAPAS) at Heidelberg University. \r Editors: Robert Folger, Felicitas Loest and Jenny St\xc3\xbcmer\rDeadline: Abstracts (250 words) are due Tuesday 9 August 2022 \rContact: publications@capas.uni-heidelberg.de \r Nuclear Ghosts\r  The derealization of the \xe2\x80\x98Other\xe2\x80\x9d means that it is neither alive nor dead, but interminably spectral. \rJudith Butler, Precarious Life\r Nuclear politics (and anxieties!) are surging once again, negotiating a variety of fantasies, speculations, and suppositions about \xe2\x80\x98the end of the world\xe2\x80\x99. Challenging the nuclear amnesia that has characterized the post-Cold War years, such nuclear imaginaries foretell the fears and desires of a world laid to waste in an effort to popularize the end time politics of the present. Meanwhile scholars such as Karen Barad, Gabriele Schwab, Elaine Scarry, and Kate Brown have long warned about the systematic silencing of (anti) nuclear debates, theorizing the unfinished business of nuclear disaster and positing a meaningful politics of re-membering nuclear trauma. In this sense, the pressing forward of nuclear apprehensions in recent years is symptomatic of what Avery Gordon identifies as \xe2\x80\x9cghostly matters\xe2\x80\x9d or a particular idea of haunting that allows us to \xe2\x80\x9cthink through repressed forms of violence that bring \xe2\x80\x98something to be done\xe2\x80\x99 in the present.\xe2\x80\x9d In this special issue we want to summon these formations of nuclear ghosts and explore the return of the (repressed) nuclear ethos in popular culture, literature, art, politics, poetry, and philosophy.\r Nuclear ghosts conjure up a critical moment or point of creative anxiety that exposes the cracks in repressive infrastructures of denial. They draw attention to the onto-epistemological ruptures and limits of the nuclear project while illuminating the political and sociocultural pressure points of nuclear threat. Nuclear ghosts thus hover at the intersection between the biopolitical and the psychological, between the ecological and the technological, the political and the intuitive, the present and the absent, then and now, critically evoking the deeply racialized and gendered genealogies of annihilating catastrophes. The ghosts we seek in this issue articulate the entanglements between atomic violence and the ongoing assaults of colonialism, sexism, capitalism, war, environmental destruction, etc., cathecting the apocalyptic ontologies of past, present, and future. They trouble dominant notions of temporality, space, and even materiality, tormenting the bruised nuclear unconscious that Derrida once evoked. Nuclear ghosts pay witness to human/posthuman atrocities and acknowledge a specific nuclear work of death as something that is simultaneously blasting and slow, too fast and too close, abstract and real. Nuclear ghosts, in other words, invoke the spectral domain of apocalyptic imaginaries in their various political scales and urgencies.\rHiroshima and Nagasaki, Chernobyl, and Fukushima all mark defining moments in nuclear history that have occupied collective narratives in countless ways (without necessarily generating lessons). These instances of spectacular (and spectral) extinction have produced eerie points of reference for extraordinary scenes of destruction. At the same time, the slow violence of nuclear testing contradicts notions of exceptional disaster, precisely because it forces itself upon a lived reality defying linear notions of time and injury. Nuclear violence seeps into the earth, the air, the body. Confounding notions of agency and resolution it mediates post/human sensibilities of haunting apt at unfolding the cataclysmic endurance of colonialization. The primary targets of these ongoing atrocities have been marginalized states and indigenous peoples in the Marshall Islands, French Polynesia, Australia, Newe Sogobia, the Christmas Islands, Hawaii, New Mexico and many more. Decolonization, in Eve Tuck\xe2\x80\x99s sense, then, attends to ghosts, confronting the violent denial done to them. \r We are particular interested in contributions that face up to these nuclear hauntings, engaging the entanglements between political violence and nuclear annihilation as tethered to specific modes of (Western) domination. What are the cultural politics of nuclear haunting? How do ghosts invoke the gendered and raced violence of nuclear trauma? When and why do nuclear repressions seize to work? How do nuclear politics reconceptualize notions of temporality and materiality? How do they name the conditions of ontological insecurity and epistemological limits? Under what conditions do nuclear ghosts invite (collective) actions or meaningful narratives about life and death? What does the nuclear imaginary tell us about past, present, and future endings of the world/worlds? \r Possible contributions might explore the topic of nuclear ghosts in relation to the following themes and ideas (the list may serve as inspiration):\r Nuclear colonialism (toxicity, sovereignty, slow death)\rNuclear reproductive politics  (gendered subjectivities, affect, queer perspectives)\rNuclear necropolitics (death worlds, race, biopolitics)\rTransspecies ethics and posthuman entanglements (scale, matter, agency)\rNuclear landscapes (waste, ruins, borderlands, and margins)\rNuclear narratives (realism, fiction, poetics)\rNuclear imaginaries, motifs, and genres (film, TV, literature, music, comics, video games, art, theatre, photography, Sci-Fi, satire, comedy, melodrama, cyberpunk, dystopia and utopia, etc.)\rNuclear temporalities (deep time, molecular time, slow violence, haunting, etc.)\rNuclear trauma (the nuclear unconscious, nuclear subjectivities, nuclear memory)\rRe-membering nuclear catastrophes (disaster fatigue, nuclear amnesia, repression)\rNuclear materialisms (body, pain, senses)\rNuclear infrastructure (architecture, design, spatiality)\rThe nuclear sublime/ the nuclear mundane\rNuclear diffraction (plurality, superposition, indeterminacy)\rNuclear desire (attachment, melancholy, mourning)\rAnti-nuclear movements (nuclear politics and anthropogenic climate disaster)\r Please send your abstract (250 words) alongside a short biographical note (50 words) to publications@capas.uni-heidelberg.de\rFull papers (8,000-9,000 words) are due 1 November 2022. \r \n'

Call For Papers: b'\n2022 5th International Conference on Computer Science and Software Engineering (CSSE 2022)\r Website: http://www.csse2022.net/ \rVenue: Guilin, China (both online and in-person)  \rConference Date: Oct. 21-23, 2022 \r 2022 5th International Conference on Computer Science and Software Engineering (CSSE 2022) will be held in Guilin, China during Oct. 21-23, 2022. It is co-organized by Guilin University of Electronic Technology, Guangxi Key Laboratory of Cryptography and Information Security and The International Society for Applied Computing (ISAC). It is sponsored by Guilin University of Electronic Technology, Guangxi Key Laboratory of Cryptography and Information Security, The International Society for Applied Computing (ISAC), and University of Santo Tomas, Philippines.  \r During the upcoming conference, the invited renowned professors will share with us the recent innovations in the fields of Computer Science and Software Engineering. The conference will mainly feature on keynote speeches as well as peer-reviewed paper presentations. In addition, social program or academic visit will be arranged to encourage communication, discussion or cooperation among the researchers in this field.\r We invite submissions of papers presenting an original high-quality research and development for the conference. All papers must be written in English and will be peer-reviewed by technical committees of the Conference and all accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings.\r *Conference Speakers:\rKeynote Speaker I: \rProf. Changsheng Xu, Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China (ACM Distinguished Scientist / IEEE Fellow / IAPR Fellow)\rKeynote Speaker II:  Prof. Xudong Jiang, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (IEEE Fellow)\rKeynote Speaker III:  Prof. Ding Yong, Guilin University Of Electronic Technology, China\r *Call for papers:\rArtificial Intelligence\rAspect-orientation and feature interaction\rBusiness Process Reengineering & Science\rCommunication Systems and Networks\rComponent-Based Software Engineering\rComputer & Software Engineering\rComputer Animation and Design Contents\rHuman-Computer Interaction\rInformation Management Systems, MIS\rInformation Systems Engineering\rMiddleware Design Techniques\rSoftware Agent Technology\rSoftware architecture and design\rSoftware components and reuse\rSoftware dependability, safety and reliability\rSoftware economics and metrics\rSoftware policy and ethics\rSoftware Process Models\r(for more topics: http://www.csse2022.net/Call%20for%20Papers.html )\r *Publication and indexing:\r\xe2\x98\x85All accepted and registered papers will be included in the Conference Proceedings and published by ACM (ISBN: 978-1-4503-9779-7), which will be archived in the ACM Digital Library, and indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus.   \r\xe2\x98\x85CSSE 2021 Conference Proceeding has been published by ACM (ISBN: 978-1-4503-9067-5) and indexed by EI Compendex and Scopus successfully within 1 month after publication! (See details)\r\xe2\x98\x85CSSE 2020 Conference Proceeding has been published by ACM (ISBN: 978-1-4503-7552-8) and indexed by EI Compendex and Scopus successfully within 2 months after publication! (See details)\r\xe2\x98\x85CSSE 2019 Conference Proceeding has been published by ACM (ISBN: 978-1-4503-7172-8) and indexed by EI Compendex and Scopus successfully about 1 month after publication! (See details)\r *Submission Methods:\r1. Online Submission System: https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CSSE2022 \r2. Submission Email: csse@applied-computing.net \r Submission guidelines: http://www.csse2022.net/Submission%20Guidelines.html \r *Join the conference as: \rAuthors: Authors are expected to submit full papers to the submission system for further review by our Technical Committees. All accepted papers after proper registration and presentation in the conference will be published and submitted for indexing.\rPresenters Only: The presenters are expected to submit abstracts only for presentation in the conference without paper publication in the conference proceedings.\rListeners: Listeners are expected to attend the conference without paper presentation or publication.\rReviewers:\rPhD-holders in the research fields of Computer Science and Software Engineering are welcome to be our reviewers and a certificate can be issued.\rSponsors/Partners: If you are interested in cooperating with us, such as sponsoring or being a partner of CSSE 2022, you are welcome to contact us at: csse@applied-computing.net\r *Contact us:\rWebsite: http://www.csse2022.net/ \rConference Secretary: Mr. Eddie Lee\rTel: (+852) 6359 2147\rEmail: csse@applied-computing.net\r If you have any question or request about our conference, no matter regarding submission, registration, participation or any further question, please send email to us and you will get feedback within 24 hours.  \r\n'

title: b'POSTDOC_LD 2022'
description: b'Post-Doctoral Researcher'
Categories: b'demography' b'labor demography' b'data analysis' b'economics'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe Max Planck Institute for Demographic Research (MPIDR) is seeking to appoint a full-time post-doctoral researcher to join the Research Group on Labor Demography.\r We welcome applications from researchers with a PhD in demography, sociology, economics, statistics, epidemiology, or a similar field. The successful candidate will work on a project aimed at understanding which factors are shaping the length of working life, and they will develop their own agenda within this project. We are seeking creative, self-driven, and collaborative scholars. Strong quantitative analysis skills are required. Knowledge of R or Stata is an advantage, as is experience with longitudinal data analysis, causal inference, or labor market research.\r We provide a stimulating research-oriented community, an excellent infrastructure, and opportunities to work with exciting datasets. The successful applicant will be offered a contract for up to 4 years with remuneration commensurate to experience (starting from approx. 57,000 EUR gross per year for researchers who have just completed their PhD, up to approx. 71,000 EUR gross per year for more senior scientists), based on the salary structure of the German public sector (\xc3\x96ffentlicher Dienst, TV\xc3\xb6D Bund). It is expected that successful applicants will be in residence at the MPIDR. Support for relocation costs is available.\r Please apply online via https://survey.demogr.mpg.de/index.php/846559?lang=en and include in a single PDF file:\r 1) Letter of interest (max. 1 page)\r 2) Curriculum Vitae (max. 3 pages, focusing on your most relevant achievements)\r 3) A writing example (e.g., one of your publications)\r 4) Contact information for up to 2 academic referees\r In order to receive full consideration, please apply by August 15. Interviews are planned for September. The exact starting date is flexible. Applicants should have completed their doctoral degree; however, PhD students who expect to obtain their degree in 2022 or early 2023 may apply.\r For inquiries about the position, please contact Christian Dudel at dudel@demogr.mpg.de.\r The MPIDR is one of the leading demographic research centers in the world. It is part of the Max Planck Society, a network of 86 institutes that form Germany\xe2\x80\x99s premier basic-research organization. Max Planck Institutes have an established record of world-class, foundational research in the sciences, technology, social sciences and the humanities. They offer a unique environment that combines the best aspects of an academic setting and a research laboratory.\r The Max Planck Society offers a broad range of measures to support the reconciliation of work and family. These are complemented by the MPIDR\xe2\x80\x99s own initiatives. For more information, see: demogr.mpg.de/go/work-family.\r In addition, there are a range of central initiatives and measures primarily geared towards helping young female researchers and mothers to advance their career. See the link below for some examples: demogr.mpg.de/go/career-development.\r We value diversity and are keen to employ individuals from minorities and under-represented groups.\r The Max Planck Society is committed to increasing the number of individuals with disabilities in its workforce and therefore encourages applications from such qualified individuals. Furthermore, the Max Planck Society seeks to increase the number of women in those areas where they are underrepresented and therefore explicitly encourages women to apply.\n\t'

title: b'ICRRR 2023'
description: b'2nd International Conference on Refugee, Resistance, and Recognition: Global Literary Representations in [Post]post-colonial Perspectives'
Categories: b'refugee and world order' b'refugee-politics of resistance' b'recognition and toleration' b'world literature'
Call For Papers: b'\nEverchanging world order and its position in the continuum rely on ongoing events and the functioning of different states\xe2\x80\x94country, government, nation, authority, community, land, etc.\xe2\x80\x94 embedded within the global makeup. The 2nd International Conference of the Department of English, Shahjalal University of Science and Technology, Sylhet 3114, Bangladesh, to be held on January 27-28, 2023, conceptualizes the narratives related to the terms\xe2\x80\x94Refugee, Resistance, and Recognition\xe2\x80\x94 and their articulations in global literary spaces both as distinct and interrelated concepts in the premises of art, literature, language, (social) media, law, and politics in [Post]postcolonial perspectives.\r The Refugee and its attendant complexities\xe2\x80\x94difficulties in ensuring political and social justice, expediting repatriation procedure, and teeming with claimants of refuge\xe2\x80\x94is a critical predicament worldwide. This conference casts a critical look into the refugees \xc2\xad\xe2\x80\x94a much-debated issue subject to multidisciplinary and scholarly approaches\xc2\xad\xe2\x80\x94in terms of the subjects\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x98positionality\xe2\x80\x99 at the intersections of class, caste, religion, race, and gender. Instead of approaching the refugee crisis through a one-sided lens, the conference plans to address refugees all over the world as a \xe2\x80\x98man-made crisis,\xe2\x80\x99 which might endorse and create space to ask questions such as i) Can we study the issue as a site whereby refugees assert their voices claiming their rights in different ways? ii) How do their movements shape the contours of the geopolitical economy and unsettle/influence the insider/outsider dichotomy? iii) What representations do they get \xe2\x80\x94their lot, agency, and voice \xe2\x80\x94in the host and other literary spaces?\r Besides these, we will further look into the narratives of Resistance and its articulation in literary representations, connecting it to the refugee crisis and also as a distinct concept. Here, we look for the narratives of dissent and unruly to conceptualize the interrelation between the refugee and the process of resistance. We will ponder how resistance has been conceptualized in the fields of rebellion and nationalist political movements against encroaching power structures? How are spatial and teleological narratives of resistance taking place in micro/macro spaces or Global North/South to bring forth/make the invisible power structures visible?\r And the subsequent stage brings forth the process of recognition. Here, we delve into the tales of resistance in personal, social, and national as well as international spheres leading to the state of recognition, be it in terms of involuntary giving in or voluntary yielding. The arena of recognition might encompass a temporary win over a disciplining authority as well as a permanent reshuffling of the encroaching policies or mechanisms of world politics. However, we do not intend to romanticize the notion of recognition; instead, we question the criterion of being eligible to be recognized and of being ineligible. Thus, we look for the nuances and politics behind the recognition process. In addition, we consider the process of recognition in different geographic locations and everyday circumstances where newer forms of center/periphery dichotomy reclaim their spaces.\r Critically and theoretically, we adopt [Post]post-colonial, albeit an askance, lens in conceptualizing the forgoing trio. Instead of maintaining an unequivocal stance on the term post-colonial, placing it on the teleological past, we aim to cast a dubious look at the parenthetical term \xe2\x80\x98post.\xe2\x80\x99 Here, the term \xe2\x80\x98post\xe2\x80\x99 does not signify colonialism as a matter of past, as something \xe2\x80\x98over.\xe2\x80\x99 Rather we see it as an unremitting phenomenon pervading all aspects of our life, albeit in newer forms like Neocolonialism or Artificial Intelligence (AI). However, our present conjecture on the term may not be beyond the realm of skepticism. This conference invites scholarly engagement with [Post] post-colonial framework whereby its pastness and presentness will be discussed and debated. Thus, it entertains an all-encompassing perspective of the viewers, reviewers, learners, critics, and readers.\r     Prospective research sub-topics for the conference include, but are not limited to:\r 1. Refugee and the New World Order                                    \r 2. Refugee and Politics of Resistance\r 3. Recognition and Toleration\r 4. 1971: War, Violence, and Trauma\r 5. Pandemic, Resistance, and Recognition\r 6. Displacement and Dislocation\r 7. Narratives of Resistance\r 8. Intersectionality and World Politics\r 9. Memory, Nostalgia, and Remembrance\r 10. Power and Subalterns\r 11. Home and (Un)home\r 12. Humanity, Border, Border-policing, and Marginalization\r 13. Ecocriticism, Anthropomorphism, and Resistance\r 14. Transnationalism, Transculturalism, and Translingualism\r 15. Gender, Transgender, and Vulnerability\r 16. Bangladeshi Writings in National and Global Perspectives\r 17. Nationalism, Cosmopolitanism, Neocolonialism, and Artificial Intelligence\r 18. Resistance and Intersection of Class, Caste, Race, Culture, and Region\r 19. Revisiting [Post]postcolonial: Limitation and Possibilities\r 20. Language, World Englishes, and Resistance\r 21. Language and English Education in Bangladesh\r 22. Climate Change and Displacement Migration\r 23. Refugee and International Migration Policy\r Important dates and information:\r Conference Date: January 27\xe2\x80\x9328, 2023\r Abstract Submission Deadline: July 25, 2022\r Notification of the Acceptance of Abstracts: August 16, 2022\r Full Paper Submission Deadline: November 20, 2022\r Registration Deadline:  December 10, 2022\r   Registration Fees:\r Presenter: BDT 1000 (Student); BDT 1500 (Independent Researcher); BDT 2000 (Faculty)\r Participant: BDT 1000; Foreign Presenter/Participant: USD$ 25\r Formal paper should be designed to be delivered in no more than 20 minutes.\r Please send 200 words abstract and a 50 words biography to con2023-eng@sust.edu or submit your abstract at https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icrrr2023 by July 25, 2022. The abstract should also include the presenter\xe2\x80\x99s affiliation (Department and University), a presentation title, and an indication of any special media or other requirements.\r Conference queries should be sent to con2023-eng@sust.edu. For more information and update, please follow us on Twitter (https://twitter.com/2ndConf_SUSTEng) and Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/engsust.edu)\n\t'

title: b'DMBD 2022'
description: b"DMBD'2022: Call for Special Session Proposals & Call for Papers "
Categories: b'data mining' b'big data' b'artificial intelligence' b'machine learning'
Call For Papers: b"\nBrief Description\r The Seventh International Conference on Data Mining and Big Data (DMBD'2022) serves as an international forum for researchers and practitioners to exchange latest advantages in theories, algorithms, models, and applications of data mining and big data as well as artificial intelligence techniques. \r The DMBD'2022 is the seventh event after the preceding Guangzhou, Belgrade, Chiang Mai, Shanghai, Fukuoka and Bali events where more than hundreds of delegates from all over the world to attend and share their latest achievements, innovative ideas, marvelous designs and excel implementations. Papers presented at DMBD'2022 will be published by Springer-Nature in Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) (indexed by EI, ISTP, DBLP, SCOPUS, ISI Web of Science, etc.). The downloads of our meeting's proceedings reach the top 25% of all publications of Springer-Nature. Some high-quality papers will be selected for SCI-indexed Jounrals (including IEEE Trans, Neurocomputing, Machine Learning with Applications, International Journal of Intelligence System, Expert System with Applications, Entropy, Electronics, Multimedia Tools and applications, etc.).\r The main theme of this year DMBD'2022 is FinTech. Recent years have witnessed an explosion in the amount of financial data. Novel FinTech technologies, such as artificial intelligence and data mining, nurture an increasing number of financial products, services, and opportunities. Several complex problems, such as investment decision making, macroeconomic analysis, asset credit evaluation etc., widely exist in the field of finance. After witnessing several promising achievements of FinTech, DMBD 2022 proposes the special track of FinTech. This track aims to collect a wide range of articles from both data mining and its application to finance, it encourages original research papers of high quality that focus on novel ways of using AI techniques to solve the finance problems.\r  Sponsored and Co-sponsored by International Association of Swarm and Evolutionary Intelligences, Peking University,Computational Intelligence Laboratory@PKU, Southern University of Science and Technology. Technically Co-sponsored/supported by IEEE Computational Intelligence Society, IEEE Beijing Chapter, World Federation of Soft Computing, International Neural Network Society, Springer-Nature, CCIS, Beijing Xinghui High-Tech Co. etc.(more to be added).\r DMBD'2022 will be held during November 21st-24th, 2022 in Beijing, China. Beijing, China\xe2\x80\x99s sprawling capital, has history stretching back 3 millennia. Yet it\xe2\x80\x99s known as much for modern architecture as its ancient sites such as the grand Forbidden City complex, the imperial palace during the Ming and Qing dynasties. Nearby, the massive Tiananmen Square pedestrian plaza is the site of Mao Zedong\xe2\x80\x99s mausoleum and the National Museum of China, displaying a vast collection of cultural relics.The 2022 Winter Olympics was an international winter multi-sport event held between 4 and 20 February 2022 in Beijing. Having previously hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics, Beijing became the first city to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Olympics.\r You are welcome to submit your Special Session Proposals (refer to https://iasei.org/dmbd2022/special_sessions.html#) or/and your latest papers to our DMBD'2022!\r DMBD'2022 Secretariat\rEmail: dmbd2022@iasei.org\rWWW: https://iasei.org/dmbd2022/contact.html\n\t"

title: b'ICEPS 2023'
description: b'2023 10th International Conference on Education and Psychological Sciences (ICEPS 2023)'
Categories: b'education' b'e-learning ' b'psychology' b'e-education'
Call For Papers: b"\nFull Name: 2023 10th International Conference on Education and Psychological Sciences (ICEPS 2023)\rAbbreviation: ICEPS 2023\rDate: January 29-31, 2023\rPlace: Bangkok, Thailand\rWebsite: http://www.iceps.org\r  Welcome from the entire organizing team, and we look forward to seeing you soon again in Bangkok, Thailand. ICEPS has been held since 2014. ICPES has been to Singapore, Spain, Italy, Netherlands and South Korea brought together delegates from around the world to consider the theme of \xe2\x80\x9cEducation and Psychological Sciences\xe2\x80\x9d. The theme was approached from a variety of different perspectives, taking full advantage of the international diversity of the attendees with their myriad experiences. The main goal of the 2023 10th International Conference on Education and Psychological Science is to provide an opportunity for academicians and professionals from various education related fields from all over the world to come together and learn from each other. An additional goal of the conference is to provide a place for academicians and professionals with cross-disciplinary interests related to education to meet and interact with members inside and outside their own particular disciplines.\r Publication\xef\xbc\x9a\rAccepted papers will be published in one of the following open access journal on the basis of the paper topics:\rInternational Journal of Information and Education Technology\r(IJIET, ISSN: 2010-3689)\rFrequency: Monthly | DOI: 10.18178/IJIET\rIndexing: Scopus (Since 2019), EI(INSPEC, IET), EBSCO, Electronic Journals Library, Google Scholar, Crossref, etc.\rPaper Template: http://www.iceps.org/IJIET_template.doc\r International Journal of Social Science and Humanity\r(IJSSH, ISSN: 2010-3646)\rFrequency: Quarterly | DOI: 10.18178/IJSSH\rIndexing:  Google Scholar, Index Copernicus, Crossref, Electronic Journals Library\rPaper Template: http://www.iceps.org/IJSSH_template.doc\r Paper submissions should be in English and must be at least 5 pages, including all the possible appendices. Extra pages (from Page 9) will be charged at 50 USD/per page. \rAll submitted articles should report original, previously unpublished research results, experimental or theoretical, and will be peer-reviewed. Articles submitted to the journal should meet these criteria and must not be under consideration for publication elsewhere. Manuscripts should follow the style of the journal and are subject to both review and editing.\r Note: For those who're NOT looking to publish their papers, it's acceptable to submit your abstracts to the conference just for oral presentation without publication, which will be sent to at least two techinical committees for a brief review, and it will take about 10 working days.\r  Conference Topics:\rEducation:\rAssessment and Evaluation\rCommunity Development\rDistance Learning\rEffective Teaching Practices\rGuidance and Counseling Psychology\rIndustrial Organization and Organization title: b'(American Dental 2023)  2023'
description: b'7th Edition of International Conference on Dentistry and Oral Health.\xe2\x80\x9d (American Dental 2023) '
Call For Papers: b"\nMagnus Group cordially invites you to join its prestigious event \xe2\x80\x9c7th Edition of International Conference on Dentistry and Oral Health.\xe2\x80\x9d (American Dental 2023) which will be organized during April 27-29, 2023 at Orlando, USA.\rIn view of the global pandemic the organizing committee has decided to hold AMERICAN DENTAL 2023 as a hybrid event with both on-site and virtual versions.\rThe conference will deliberate on the theme \xe2\x80\x9cBlending Today's Lifestyle with Dental Trends for Vibrant Smiles.\xe2\x80\x9d\r To commemorate the 7th anniversary of dentistry and oral health conference, this year the meeting will host a mega event featuring plenary talks by international keynote speakers, distinguished guest speakers, researchers, healthcare professionals, dentists, oral care experts, dental hygienists, academicians and scientists from various countries, and renowned stalwarts of dentistry from worldwide. This fiesta will be a testament to the coming together of young and professionals in order to exchange and embrace scientific viewpoints and broaden their horizons of knowledge. The hybrid event will focus on many interesting scientific sessions and covers all frontier topics in dentistry and oral health including Tele dentistry and the future of remote diagnosis and treatment, Orthodontics & Dentofacial Orthopedics, Dental Biomaterials & Bioengineering and Advanced Dental Research.\rReach us at: \rContact Email: dentistry@magnusconference.com \rPhone: +1 (702) 988-2320\rWhatsApp: +1 434 264 7183\rDates: April27-29, 2023 \rVenue: Orlando, USA\rWebsite: https://magnusconferences.com/dental/\rAbstract submission: https://magnusconferences.com/dental/submit-abstract \rRegistration: https://magnusconferences.com/dental/register \rSocial Media Link: \rFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/dentalconfer \rTwitter: https://twitter.com/DentistryOral \rLinkedIn: \rYouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLtH0EIiRfFWaIOwuYL5IEw\r  Organiser:\rMagnus Group LLC - https://www.magnusgroup.org/ \rConference Manager: Regina Brown\rOrganiser Address: Magnus Group LLC\r                                   150 South Wacker Drive #2400\r                                   Chicago, IL 60606, USA\r  Dental Conferences | Dental Conferences 2023 | Dentistry Conferences | Dentistry Conferences 2023 | Oral Health Conferences | Oral Health Congress | Dentistry Meetings | Dental Events | American Dental 2023 | Dentistry 2023 | Dentistry Workshops | Dental Summit | Dental Symposium | Oral Health Events | Dental Conference | Dentistry Conference | Oral Health Meetings | Dental Conferences USA | USA Dental Conferences | Online Dental Conferences | Dentistry Webinars | Dental Meetings | Dentistry Events | Oral Health Summit\r \n"

title: b'ICLLA 2023'
description: b'2023 10th International Conference on Linguistics, Literature and Arts (ICLLA 2023)'
Categories: b'literature' b'linguistics' b'arts' b'culture'
Call For Papers: b"\nFull Name: 2023 10th International Conference on Linguistics, Literature and Arts (ICLLA 2023)\rAbbreviation: ICLLA 2023\rTime: January 29-31, 2023       \rPlace: Bangkok, Thailand\rWebsite of Conference: http://www.iclla.org\r  Please mark your calendars for 2023 10th International Conference on Linguistics, Literature and Arts (ICLLA 2023) during January 29-31, 2023, which will be held in Bangkok, Thainland! Our main topic is about language, literature and arts. Now, the submission and registration links are opened. If you submit the full paper or abstract, the notification letter will be issued by notification deadline. If you only want to attend the conference as a listener, please register now and inform the conference secretary.\rICLLA 2023 aims to bring together researchers, scientists, engineers, and scholar students to exchange and share their experiences, new ideas, and research results about all aspects of language, literature and arts, and discuss the practical challenges encountered and the solutions adopted. The conference will be held every year to make it an ideal platform for people to share views and experiences in language, literature and arts and related areas.\r Announcement: Due to the outbreak of the coronavirus, Online/Video Presentation are acceptable on the conference. Online presentation session will be arranged accordingly. Please contact the conference secretary for more information about Online/Video Presentation.\rParticipants are required to wear face mask when attending the conference. And conference staff will check the body temperature and take other active action.\r Call for TPC\rICLLA 2023 respectfully asks scholars and experts in language, literature and arts related fields to consider being a member of the Technical Program Committee. If you are interested or if you have someone to recommend, please send your/their CV/s to iclla@iedrc.net. All received CVs will be carefully reviewed and discussed.\rTPC member's name, affiliation and nationality will be shown on the webpage for ICLLA 2023 as well. Welcome to join us.\r Submission Guidelines\rTo publish the full paper into Journal International Journal of Languages, Literature and Linguistics (IJLLL) and give the oral presentation, please send us the full paper.\rTo give presentation only, please just send us the abstract.\rSubmission Method:\r1. By Online System: http://confsys.iconf.org/submission/iclla2023\r2. By Email: iclla@iedrc.net\r Submission Requirements\rLanguage:\rEnglish is the official language of the conference; the paper should be written and presented only in English.\r Presentation & Publication (Full paper):\rFull paper is requested, if you also consider publishing your paper.\rAll submitted articles should report original, previously unpublished research results, experimental or theoretical. Articles submitted to the Conference should not be under consideration for publication elsewhere. Manuscripts should follow the style of the Conference and are subject to both review and editing. Authors retain the right to publish an extended, significantly updated version in another periodical.\r Oral Presentation Only (Abstract):\rIf you just want to make an oral presentation during ICLLA 2023 without paper publication, then you can only submit an abstract.\r Paper Template:http://www.iclla.org/IJLLL_template.doc\rPlease edit your paper with corresponding template. The paper template will be considered as one of the review parts. Please do pay attention to it.\rEach paper should be at least 5 full pages, and additional pages(\xef\xbc\x9e8) will be chargeable.\r Publication:\rAll submissions will be peer reviewed, and the accepted papers will be published in the International Journal of Languages, Literature and Linguistics(IJLLL), which will be indexed by Google Scholar and Crossref.\r  *Please submit your articles to the conference before the deadline. The review process may take about 3-4 weeks. \r Call for Papers:\r Topics of interest for submission include, but are not limited to: \r *Linguistics\rApplied Linguistics\rDiscourse Analysis\rLanguage for Specific Purposes\rLanguage Education\rLanguage, Literature and Ideology\rAutonomy in language learning\rTeaching language skills and elements\rThe Knowledge Base of Language Teacher Education\rSocial, Cultural, and Political Contexts of Language Teacher Education\rCollaborations in Language Teacher Education\rPractices of Language Teacher Education\rThe transformative nature of the role of language and communication in human cognition\rThe analysis of language and language use as providing a window into non-linguistic cognitive\rProcesses and structures\r *Input and output of large character sets of Asian languages\rTypesetting and font designs of Asian languages\rAsian character encoding and compression\rMultimodal representations and processing\rVoice input and output\rPhonology and morphology\rLexical semantics and word sense\rGrammars, syntax, semantics and discourse\rWord segmentation, chunking, tagging and syntactic parsing\rWord sense disambiguation, semantic role labeling and semantic parsing\rDiscourse analysis\rLanguage, linguistic and speech resource development\rEvaluation methods and user studies\r ......\rmore topics available @ http://www.iclla.org/cfp.html\r Conference Program:\rDay 1 - 29 January, 2023-Sign-in for ICLLA 2023\rDay 2 - 30 January, 2023-Openning Remarks & Keynote Speech & Invited Speech & Session Presentations\rDay 3 - 31 January, 2023-Invited Speech & Session Presentations\r Contact Us\rConference Secretary: Ms. Joe Zhou\rEmail: iclla@iedrc.net\rTel : +86-13648043904\n\t"

Call For Papers: b'\nFull Name: 2023 6th International Conference on Aeronautical, Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering (AAME 2023)\rAbbreviation: AAME 2023\rFebruary 24-26, 2023 | Nanjing, China\rhttp://www.icaam.org\r After the successful past AAME conference from 2018 to 2022, 2023 6th International Conference on Aeronautical, Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering (AAME 2023) will be held in Nanjing, China during February 24-26, 2023. AAME 2023 will create a global platform to experts and scholars in all related fields to communicate and explore frontier technology. We are warmly welcome all scholars at home and abroad to attend the conference and submit papers!\r **Proceedings\rAll accepted papers after proper registration and presentation, will be published published by IOP Conference Series. Indexed by Ei Compendex, Scopus, Thomson Reuters (WoS), Inspec.\r\xe2\x97\x8f AAME 2022 - Journal of Physics: Conference Series. Vol. 638 | Ei-Compendex & Scopus\r\xe2\x97\x8f AAME 2018 - MATEC Web of Conferences, Volume 202 (2018) | Ei-Compendex & Scopus\r **Organizing Committees\rConference Chairs\r\xe2\x97\x8f Prof. John Mo, Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, Australia\r\xe2\x97\x8f Prof. Yan Wang, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, China\rTechnical Program Chairs\r\xe2\x97\x8f Prof. Anatolii Kretov, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, China\r\xe2\x97\x8f Prof. Jing Liu, Northwestern Polytechnical University, China\r\xe2\x97\x8f Prof. Zheng Hong Zhu, York University, Canada\rTechnical Program Co-Chair\r\xe2\x97\x8f Assoc. Prof. Yongjie Zhang, Northwestern Polytechnical University, China\r **Submission\rAAME 2023 now is accepting submissions both full paper and abstract.\rPlease submit your paper to us: aame_conf@126.com or submit via link: http://confsys.iconf.org/submission/aame2023\r **Conference Schedule\rFebruary 24th, 2023: Registration and Arrival of Participants \rFebruary 25th, 2023: Keynote speeches& Plenary speeches& parallel sessions\rFebruary 26th, 2023: Academic Visiting / One day Tour (Pending)  \r **Contact Us\rMs. Katharine Shui\rConference Secretary of AAME\rEmail: aame_conf@126.com\rTel: +86-18482379767\r(office time 9:30 - 18:00, Time zone: GMT+8; Monday to Friday)\n\t'

title: b'IEEE ICPST 2023'
description: b'IEEE--2023 The International Conference on Power Science and Technology (ICPST 2023)'
Categories: b'energy' b'power' b'sustainable development' b'electronics'
Call For Papers: b'\nFull Name\xef\xbc\x9aIEEE--2023 The International Conference on Power Science and Technology (ICPST 2023)\rabbreviation\xef\xbc\x9a ICPST 2023\rhttp://icpst.org/index.html\rKunming, China | Jan 6-8, 2023\r \xe2\x97\x8fSponsored by: Kunming University of Science and Technology\r                          Science and Engineering Institute\r \xe2\x97\x8fCo-sponsored by: Huazhong University of Science and Technology\r                               South China University of Technology\r \xe2\x97\x8fOrganized by: School of Electrical Power Engineering, Kunming University of Science and Technology\r  ICPST 2023 will feature contributed papers, keynote & invited talks, special sessions, as well as parallel sessions, where you will meet and network with researchers in power science and technology and others who are interested in the latest techniques in the field of power engineering. On behalf of the organizing committee, we warmly invite you to take part in the conference. With your participation and contribution, together, we shall advance the state-of-the-art in the field of power science and techniques and their applications.\r \xe2\x97\x8f All submissions will be peer reviewed, and all the accepted papers will be published in the *IEEE conference Proceedings*, which will be inclusion into IEEE Xplore, and indexed by *EI Compendex and Scopus*.\r Please visit "http://www.icpst.org/ " for more details\r  \xe2\x85\xa1. Submission Methods( Full paper or abstract )\r      \xe2\x97\x8f Please log in the Submission System(https://www.zmeeting.org/submission/icpst2023) to submit your paper \r     \xe2\x97\x8f Send E-mail to icpst@sciei.org\r  \xe2\x85\xa2. Call for Papers \r ICPST will provide a premier interdisciplinary platform for researchers, practitioners and educators to present and discuss the most recent innovations, trends, and concerns as well as practical challenges encountered and solutions adopted in the fields of power science and technology.\r Topics are interested but not limited to:\r *Power System and Key Technologies*\rPower converters\rTransmission and Distribution\rPower Quality\rPower System Analysis\rPower Electronics\rPulsed Power Systems\rPower System Reliability\rDistributed Generation\rElectrical Machines and Transformers\rPower Electronics and Drives\r *Power Control and Operation Management*\rTransport electrification\rNew Energy Vehicles, Electric Vehicles\rPower System Operation and Planning\rPower Systems Control & Protection\rDiagnostics & Condition Monitoring\rElectricity Market and Power System Economics\rPower Engineering Education\rElectric Grid of the Future\r...\r IV.  Awards\r *Best paper award*\r *Best student paper award*\r *Best oral presentation award*\r *Best poster award*\r  V. Conference Secretary: Ms. Ashily Qi\r      E-mail:  icpst_conference@163.com\r      Tel: +86 13709044764\r \n'

title: b'H2RC 2022'
description: b"Eighth International Workshop on Heterogeneous High-performance Reconfigurable Computing (H2RC'22)"
Categories: b'reconfigurable computing' b'FPGA' b'HPC'
Call For Papers: b'\nAs conventional von-Neumann architectures are suffering from rising power densities, we are facing an era with power, energy efficiency, and cooling as first-class constraints for scalable HPC. FPGAs can tailor the hardware to the application, avoiding overheads and achieving higher hardware efficiency than general-purpose architectures. Leading FPGA manufacturers have recently made a concerted effort to provide a range of higher-level, easier-to-use high-level programming models for FPGAs, and much of the work in FPGA-based deep learning is built on these frameworks.\r Such initiatives are already stimulating new interest within the HPC community around the potential advantages of FPGAs over other architectures. With this in mind, this workshop, now in its eighth year, brings together HPC and heterogeneous-computing researchers to demonstrate and share experiences on how newly-available high-level programming models, including OpenCL, are already empowering HPC software developers to directly leverage FPGAs, and to identify future opportunities and needs for research in this area.\n\t'

b'

2nd International Conference on Big Data, IoT and Machine Learning (BIOM 2022)

October 22 ~ 23, 2022, Sydney, Australia

Due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, registered authors are now able to present their work through our online platforms.

Scope & Topics

2nd International Conference on Big Data, IoT and Machine Learning (BIOM 2022) will act as a major forum for the presentation of innovative ideas, approaches, developments, and research projects in the areas of Big Data, Internet of Things (IoT) and Machine Learning. It will also serve to facilitate the exchange of information between researchers and industry professionals to discuss the latest issues and advancement in the area of Big Data, IoT and Machine Learning.

Authors are solicited to contribute to the conference by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the following areas, but are not limited to.

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following

  • 5G and Networks for Big Data
  • Big Data Analytics and Social Media
  • Big Data Applications, Bioinformatics, Multimedia etc
  • Big Data Infrastructure and platform
  • Big Data Management
  • Big Data Mining
  • Big Data Search and Mining
  • Big Data Security, Privacy and Trust
  • Big Data Techniques, models and algorithms
  • Big Data Tools and systems
  • Cloud and grid computing for Big Data
  • Connectivity and Networking
  • Deep Learning
  • Electronics and Signal processing for IoT
  • Experimental Results and Deployment Scenarios
  • Internet of Things
  • IoT Applications and Services
  • IoT-enabled Innovation and Entrepreneurship
  • Learning in knowledge-intensive systems
  • Learning Methods and analysis
  • Learning Problems
  • Machine Learning and AI for Big Data
  • Machine Learning Applications
  • Security and Privacy for IoT

Paper Submission

Authors are invited to submit papers through the conference Submission System by August 27, 2022. Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this conference. The proceedings of the conference will be published by Computer Science Conference Proceedings (H index 31) in Computer Science & Information Technology (CS & IT) series (Confirmed).

Selected papers from BIOM 2022, after further revisions, will be published in the special issues of the following journals.

  • International Journal of Data Mining & Knowledge Management Process (IJDKP)
  • International Journal of Database Management Systems (IJDMS)
  • Machine Learning and Applications: An International Journal (MLAIJ)
  • Advances in Vision Computing: An International Journal (AVC)
  • International Journal of Grid Computing & Applications (IJGCA)
  • International Journal of Ambient Systems and Applications (IJASA)
  • International Journal on Web Service Computing (IJWSC)

Important Dates

Submission Deadline: August 27, 2022
Authors Notification: October 01, 2022
Final Manuscript Due: October 08, 2022
'

The journal focuses on all technical and practical aspects of security and its applications for wired and wireless networks. The goal of this journal is to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to focus on understanding Modern security threats and countermeasures, and establishing new collaborations in these areas.Topics of InterestNetwork and Wireless Network SecurityMobile, Ad Hoc and Sensor Network SecurityPeer-to-Peer Network SecurityDatabase and System SecurityIntrusion Detection and PreventionInternet Security & ApplicationsSecurity & Network ManagementE-mail security, Spam, Phishing, E-mail fraudVirus, worms, Trojon ProtectionSecurity threats & countermeasures (DDoS, MiM, Session Hijacking, Replay attack etc,)Ubiquitous Computing SecurityWeb 2.0 securityCryptographic protocolsPerformance Evaluations of Protocols & Security ApplicationPaper SubmissionAuthors are invited to submit papers for this journal through E-mail: ijnsa@airccse.org or through Submission System. Call For Papers: b"\nThe 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Smart  Environments (ICAISE'2022)\r   24-26 November 2022, Errachidia, Morocco\r  Hybrid conference\r The 4th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Smart Environments (ICAISE\xe2\x80\x992022) is organised by IDMS research team (Business Intelligence and Systems Modeling) from the Engineering Science and Technology (STI) laboratory, and MMIS research team (Mathematical and Computer Systems Modeling) ) of the MAIS Laboratory (Applied Mathematics, Computer Science and Systems).\r The objective of bringing together innovative scientists, professors, research scholars, students and industrial experts in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Smart Environments to a common forum. The primary goal of the conference is to promote the exchange of innovative scientific information between researchers, developers, engineers, students, and practitioners. Another goal is to promote the transformation of fundamental research into institutional and industrialized research and to convert applied exploration into real time application. Overall, the conference will provide the researchers and attendees with prospects for national and international collaboration and networking among universities and institutions from Morocco and abroad for promoting research.\r ICAISE\xe2\x80\x992022 will be held at the Faculty of Sciences and Technic, Moulay Ismail University, Errachidia, MOROCCO.\r All the accepted papers (after double blinded peer review) will be published as proceedings of ICAISE\xe2\x80\x992022 by Springer Lecture Notes in Networks & Systems (Indexing: SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago; All books published in the series are submitted for consideration in Web of Science) and extended selected papers will be published in the special issues of SCI/SCOPUS/WoS/DBLP/ACM indexed Journals.\r The aim of ICAISE\xe2\x80\x992022 is to bring together researchers, engineers and practitioners, from all areas of computer science, to present their latest ideas and research results within the scope of ICAISE\xe2\x80\x992022. The conference will include presentations of contributed papers, poster sessions, and state-of-the-art lectures by invited keynote speakers.\r  Proceedings Partners\r The proceedings of ICAISE'2022 will be published by Springer Lecture Notes in Networks & Systems (Indexing: SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago; All books published in the series are submitted for consideration in Web of Science).\n\t"

title: b'Disrupting Norms in Supernatural Teen Se 2022'
description: b'Black Witches & Queer Ghosts: Disrupting Norms in Supernatural Teen Serials'
Categories: b'television studies' b'popular culture' b'teen supernatural serials' b'race gender sexuality'
Call For Papers: b'\nWhile fascination with the supernatural has an extensive history, combining teen subjects and audiences with supernatural topics is a fairly contemporary form of entertainment. Serials like Teen Wolf, The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina, and the Vampire Diaries center their narratives on supernatural subjects while occasionally addressing topics that are relevant to teen audiences. Despite the gains made in media regarding inclusion, there are instances when topics, such as race, gender, and sexuality, are avoided in teen serials, which, it may be argued, should be safe spaces where addressing these subjects is most needed. This collection seeks to examine instances in teen supernatural serials that effectively address socially relevant topics, exploring how these subjects are broached while adhering to the overarching theme, and to explore instances in which these serials avoid social issues, opting instead to perform an erasure of any theme that might stray from an \xe2\x80\x98American family values\xe2\x80\x99 perspective. Some possible topics include, but are not limited to, the following:\r \xe2\x80\xa2\tDepictions of race, or lack thereof\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tDisrupting the heteronormative \r\xe2\x80\xa2\tFeminist activism or rejecting feminism \r\xe2\x80\xa2\tRejecting religion or embracing religious ideology \r\xe2\x80\xa2\tFamily structures and disruptions\r  Some possible teen supernatural serials include, but are not limited to:\r \xe2\x80\xa2\tVampire Diaries\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tThe Chilling Adventures of Sabrina\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tBuffy the Vampire Slayer\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tHemlock Grove\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tStranger Things\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tBlack Lightning\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tLegacies\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tRaising Dion\r For consideration, please submit a 50-word author biography and a 300-word abstract, including a reference list of 5 peer-reviewed sources minimum, with current affiliation and contact email address to calexander@tuskegee.edu.\r Final essays should be between 5000 and 7000 words, follow the Chicago Manual of Style, 16th ed., use 12 pt. Times New Roman font (all text including endnotes), double space, and have 1-inch margins (all around).\r Due dates:\r Abstract/Bio/References\t\t\t        November 1, 2022\rAcceptance Notice\t\t\t\tNovember 20, 2022\rRough Draft\t\t\t\t\tFebruary 28, 2023\rFirst Edit\t\t\t\t\tMay 31, 2023\rFinal Version\t\t\t\t\tJuly 31, 2023\r N.B. This collection is currently under contract with Lexington Books and due in 2023.\r\n'

title: b'ROOTS 2022'
description: b'Reversing and Offensive-oriented Trends Symposium'
Categories: b'computer science' b'security' b'communications'
Call For Papers: b'\nReversing and Offensive-oriented Trends Symposium 2022 (ROOTS)\r=====================================================================\rco-located with DeepSec 2022 November 17/18, Vienna, Austria\r  Call for Papers\r The Reversing and Offensive-oriented Trends Symposium is -again- co-located with the DeepSec conference in its sixth year. ROOTS solicits contributions that focus on theorems and root shells: In security, two things you absolutely cannot argue with.\rSecurity is hard to define. Most often, security is defined by its absence. For scientists, this is particularly unsatisfactory. A lack of definition increases the difficulty to find suitable quantitive and qualitative models. Even though the overall landscape is blurry at best; exploitation, reverse engineering, and offensive techniques have their place. ROOTS aims to explore this territory.\r The first European symposium of its kind, ROOTS aims to provide an industry-friendly academic platform to discuss trends in exploitation, reversing, offensive techniques, and effective protections. Submissions should provide novel attack forms, describe novel reversing techniques, or effective deployable defenses. Submissions can also provide a comprehensive overview of the state-of-the-art, and pinpoint promising areas that have not received appropriate attention in the past.\r Topics of interest include but are not limited to:\r - New exploitation techniques and methodologies\r- New reverse engineering techniques and methodologies\r- The science of (in)security\r- The role of exploitation in the science of security\r- The role of reverse engineering in the science of security\r- Novel approaches to security scalability, in the actual world or in simulated environments (CTF)\r- New unintended programming and execution models (\xe2\x80\x9cweird machines\xe2\x80\x9d)\rwherein the program is encoded in data, metadata, descriptors, etc.\r- Automated code analysis and semantic understanding\r- Formal models of exploitation and formal methods for exploitation\r- Systematization of knowledge in exploitation\r- Systematization of knowledge in reverse engineering\r- Exploitation of trending platforms and architectures: IoT, cloud, SDNs, etc.\r- Reverse engineering of trending platforms and architectures: embedded systems, IoT, cloud, SDNs, etc.\r- Exploitation perspectives on emerging trust models: SGX, enclaves, blockchains, etc.\r Important dates\r Submission deadline: August 26 (anywhere in the world)\rAuthor notification: October 03\rCamera-ready papers due: October 15\rWorkshop and DeepSec: November 17/18\r Program Chairs\r Adrian Dabrowski, CISPA Helmholz Center for Information Security\rRen\xc3\xa9 Pfeiffer,  DeepSec\r Reviewers\r Patroklos Argyroudis, CENSUS S.A.\rJean-Philippe Aumasson, Taurus\rSergey Bratus, Dartmouth College\rMariano Graziano, Cisco Talos\rFelicitas Hetzelt, TU Berlin\rMartina Lindorfer, University of Technology, Vienna\rGeorg Merzdovnik, SBA Research\rSebastian Neuner, Google LLC\rMarcus Niemietz, Niederrhein University of Applied Sciences\rKonrad Rieck, TU Braunschweig\rMichael Schwarz, CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security\rJuraj Somorovsky, Paderborn University\rAlexios Voulimeneas, KU Leuven\rEdgar Weippl, University of Vienna\r  Submission and Details\r see https://www.roots-conference.org/cfp.html\r   \n'

title: b'IEEE TNSE Special Issue 2022'
description: b'IEEE TNSE Special Issue on Next-generation Traffic Measurement with Network-wide Perspective and Artificial Intelligence'
Categories: b'computer network' b'traffic measurement' b'network-wide measurement' b'artificial intelligence'
Call For Papers: b"\nTraffic measurement is deemed as the bedrock of the next-generation network systems. Its function is to monitor network traffic at all protocol layers, from the physical layer to the applications, and to capture traffic patterns, relationships, and anomalies in the time dimension and volume dimension to support fundamental network functions and upper-layer services, such as load balancing, routing, intrusion detection, traffic engineering, and performance diagnosis. Recently, the explosive Internet traffic growth, the emerging networking paradigms, and the surging network service demands have opened new challenges for traffic measurement, which have gained significant attention from both academia and industry. However, the state-of-the-art solutions, which mainly focus on single-point measurement scenarios and derive probabilistic formulas to measure elementary metrics like frequency, cardinality, and persistence, cannot meet the arising heterogeneous and fine-grained measurement requirements on performance, throughput, scalability, response time, and diversity. For example, modern switches can forward packets at extremely high throughput (up to several Gpps), practically two orders of magnitude higher than the throughput of existing sketch solutions. For another example, application-oriented sketches that provide timely and accurate features beyond elementary metrics to applications like traffic engineering and intrusion detection systems can undoubtedly benefit such systems, while the design of such sketches and the derivation of measurement formulas are non-trivial problems. Thus, there is an urgent need for systematic and in-depth research on network-wide and AI-powered traffic measurement methods to meet new network traffic characteristics and support emerging applications.\r It is expected that the next-generation network management systems will feature network-wide measurement algorithms. The big network data is distributed in nature as the sources and destinations of connections may span the entire network. It is thus essential to aggregate the views of multiple measurement points to build a network-wide perception and capture comprehensive and accurate traffic information. Besides, with a proper task breakdown schema, multiple measurement points can federatively run measurements in a completely parallel and distributed manner, reducing the computation overhead and hardware requirement. Another latest trend involves artificial intelligence technologies that allow seamless aggregation of multi-resolution and heterogeneous network traffic data while advancing traffic measurement systems' design, deployment, and application. Additionally, the interplay between traffic measurement and artificial intelligence is bidirectional. Besides using AI intelligence to power traffic measurement, traffic measurement methods can also aid the AI systems since AI systems are often deployed in a decentralized environment where communication plays an important role. For instance, sketches, a family of traditional measurement methods, can naturally compress the input data and approximate its distribution. It can be used as the medium to transfer gradients among distributed AI systems, striking a tradeoff among information compression, convergence time, and system accuracy.\r This special issue is intended to encourage scholars and experts to systematically discuss the latest research progress and development trends for next-generation traffic measurement, promote in-depth research, and share academic and technical achievements.\r The topics of this SI include, but are not limited to:\r - Network-wide traffic measurement algorithms and systems\r- Use of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data analytics in network traffic measurement and its applications\r- Network-wide and/or AI-powered traffic measurement for the Internet, edge networks, data center networks, cloud-based systems, software-defined networks, online social networks, online services, and next-generation networks\r- Traffic measurement with programmable hardware and software platforms\r- Traffic measurement with privacy preservation and anonymization\r- AI-powered design, simulation, modeling, analysis, and visualization for next-generation traffic measurement\r- Validation and repeatability of network-wide and/or AI-powered traffic measurements, shared datasets, or collaborative platforms\r- Novel applications of network-wide and AI-powered traffic measurement for load balancing, flow scheduling, network management, and network evolution\r- Novel applications of network-wide and AI-powered traffic measurement for security, anomaly/vulnerability/attack detection, and user profiling/privacy\r- Novel applications of traffic measurement for artificial intelligence and machine learning\r Submission Guidelines\r Papers submitted to this special issue for possible publication must be original and must not be under consideration for publication in any other journal or conference.\rAll papers are to be submitted through the journal editorial submission system. At the beginning of the submission process in the submission system, authors need to select \xe2\x80\x9cSpecial Issue on Next-generation Traffic Measurement with Network-wide Perspective and Artificial Intelligence\xe2\x80\x9d as the article type.\rAll manuscripts must be prepared according to the journal publication guidelines, which can also be found on the website provided above. Papers will be evaluated following the journal's standard review process.\rAll papers will be reviewed by at least three reviewers for their technical merit, scope, and relevance to the CFP.\r Important Dates\r Manuscripts Due: 15 December 2022\rFirst-Round Peer Reviews to Authors: 15 March 2023\rRevised Manuscripts Due: 1 May 2023\rFinal Decision: 1 June 2023\rEstimated Publication Date: Fourth Quarter 2023\r Guest Editors\r He Huang (Lead), Soochow University, China\rShigang Chen, University of Florida, USA\rRan Ben Basat, University College London, UK\rHaipeng Dai, Nanjing University, China\rAmirhosein Taherkordi, University of Oslo, Norway\rJun (Jim) Xu, Georgia Institute of Technology, USA\n\t"

Call For Papers: b'\n2022 2nd International Conference on Intelligent Power and Systems (ICIPS 2022)\r \xe3\x80\x90Conference Introdution\xe3\x80\x91\r2022 2nd International Conference on Intelligent Power and Systems (ICIPS 2022) will be held during\xc2\xa0November 18-20, 2022 in Chengdu, China.\rICIPS 2022 will bring together top professionals from industry, government, and academia from around the world. We invite submissions of papers and abstracts on all topics related to power electronics and power system. The conference will provide networking opportunities for participants to share ideas, designs, and experiences on the state-of-the-art and future direction of\xc2\xa0power electronics\xc2\xa0and power system.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0We hope that you will take this opportunity to join us for academic exchange and visit the city of Chengdu.\xc2\xa0\r \xe3\x80\x90Conference Website\xe3\x80\x91http://www.icips.net\r \xe3\x80\x90Publication\xe3\x80\x91\rAll papers will be reviewed by two or three experts from the committees. title: b'DICG 2022'
description: b'3rd International Workshop on Distributed Infrastructure for Common Good'
Categories: b'decentralized systems' b'blockchain' b'distributed middleware' b'decentralized infrastructure'
Call For Papers: b"\nPrivate ownership of infrastructures does not seem to solve the traditional problems of Tragedy of Commons: pollution (spam and bot network on social media), over-exhaustion of resources (net neutrality), and fairness (gig economy). Privatization of digital commons also introduces the potential for monopolistic abuse, such as: stifled innovation, price discriminations, and distorted market knowledge discovery. We aim to explore within this workshop viable alternatives to 'winner-takes-all' platform ecosystems. Failure of market mechanisms to address these issues suggest that such infrastructures could be treated as commons. We recognize the promising avenue of research build on Nobel laureate Ostroms idea that commons is the third way to organize complex human cooperation, beyond capitalist regulation or governmental regulations.\r Scientific challenges include, but are not limited to: the Tragedy of the Commons in such shared-resource systems, fake identities with Sybil attacks, robot economy, trustworthiness in general, self-organizing machine learning, market infrastructures in cashless society, and governance issues in decentralized systems.\r This workshop focuses on the tools, frameworks, and algorithms to support the common good in a distributed environment. Both theoretical work and experimental approaches are welcomed. Reproducibility, open source and public datasets are endorsed. Each submission must clearly contribute to the middleware community, to facilitate the development of applications by providing higher-level abstractions for better programmability, performance, scalability, and security.\r Scope:\r The topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r-Distributed algorithms\r-Trust and reputation systems\r-Fault-tolerance\r-Gossip-based learning and behavioral models\r-Self-sovereign identity\r-Peer-to-peer networks\r-Game-theoretic approaches to tragedy of commons\r-Markets, mechanism design, and incentives\r-Computational social choice\r-Incentives for participants\r-Fairness in market systems\r-Decentralized governance\n\t"

title: b'EAI MobiQuitous 2022'
description: b'19th EAI International Conference on Mobile and Ubiquitous Systems: Computing, Networking and Services'
Categories: b'mobile systems' b'networking' b'computing' b'ubiquitous computing'
Call For Papers: b'\nEAI MobiQuitous 2022 will be held as a fully-fledged online conference (with an on-site possibility). If the local situation allows it, the event will take place on-site in its original location with an option for all authors to present remotely. In any case,\rall matters related to publication and indexing will remain unchanged.\r Scope\r Despite the considerable research effort in the area of Mobile and Ubiquitous Computing over the nearly two decades, and the maturity of some of its base technologies, many challenges persist. The goal of the 19th annual International Conference on Mobile and Ubiquitous Systems: Computing, Networking and Services (MobiQuitous 2022) is to provide a forum for presenting and discussing high-quality research in the field, involving international practitioners and researchers from diverse backgrounds. MobiQuitous 2022 will thus foster research collaboration through focused discussions, interaction and exchange of experiences that will designate future research efforts and directions. Areas addressed by the conference include systems, applications, social networks, middleware, networking, sensing, data management, data processing and services, all with special focus on mobile and ubiquitous computing.\r ***\r Publication\r All registered papers will be submitted for publishing by Springer and made available through SpringerLink Digital Library: MobiQuitous Conference Proceedings.\r MobiQuitous proceedings are indexed in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.\r Authors of selected best accepted and presented papers will be invited to submit an extended version to:\r- Mobile Networks and Applications (MONET) Journal (IF: 2.659)\r- Springer Wireless Networks Journal (WINET) [IF: 2.602 (2020)]\r All accepted authors are eligible to submit an extended version in a fast track of:\r- EAI Endorsed Transactions on Industrial Networks and Intelligent Systems (Open Access) \xe2\x80\x93 indexed in Scopus\r- EAI Endorsed Transactions on Mobile Communications and Applications (Open Access)\r Additional publication opportunities:\r-EAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series\r(titles in this series are indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)\r ***\r General Chair\rWei Gao, University of Pittsburgh\r General Co-Chairs\rMahanth Gowda, Pennsylvania State University\r Technical Program Committee Chairs\rLongfei Shangguan, University of Pittsburgh\r Bodhi Priyantha, Principal Researcher, Microsoft Research\r ***\r Topics\r We welcome contributions from the following fields:\r - Mobile User Experience\r- Security and Privacy\r- User Behaviour Analysis and Modelling\r- Crowdsourcing \xe2\x80\x93 Platforms and Applications\r- Internet of Things \xe2\x80\x93 Systems, Data Analytics, and Applications\r- Urban/mobile Crowd-sensing\r- Participatory Sensing\r- Wireless Access Technologies\r- Performance Analysis, Modelling and Measurement of Mobile Networks\r- Wearable Computing\r- Body Area Networks\r- Mobile Data Analysis and Mobile Platforms\r- Mobile Multimedia\r- Mobile User Interfaces and Interaction Technologies\r- Toolkit and Languages for Mobile Computing\r- Networked Sensing and Applications\r- Mobile Device Architectures\r- Mobile Systems and Applications\r- Mobile Data Management and Analytics\r- Energy Aware Mobile Computing\r- Pervasive Sensing\r- Localization and Tracking\r- Activity Recognition\r- Social Network Applications to Mobile Computing\r- Context and Location-based Applications and Services\r- AI and Machine Learning Algorithms and Application for Mobile Computing\r- Mobile Augmented Reality/Mixed Reality\r- Mobile Cloud Computing\r ***\r This event is organized by EAI (www.eai.eu).\r EAI \xe2\x80\x93 European Alliance for Innovation is a non-profit organization and a professional community established in cooperation with the European Commission to empower the global research and innovation, and to promote cooperation between European and International ICT communities.\n\t'

Call For Papers: b'\nFull name: ACM--2023 The 10th International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Applications (Europe)(ICIEA 2023)\rAbbreviation: ICIEA 2023-Europe\rhttp://iciea.eu/\r The 2023 The 10th International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Applications (ICIEA 2023-Europe) is to be held in Rome, Italy during January 09-11, which is focusing on the European latest achievements in industrial engineering and application.\r ICIEA is the leading conference to disseminate, to all branches of industries, information on the most recent and relevant research, theories and practices in ICIEA. All submissions are subjected to rigorous review before an acceptance decision is made. This conference has been attended by more than 1000 participants from 50 countries since 2014 and successfully be held in Sydney, Singapore, Hong Kong, Nagoya, Tokyo, Paris etc.\r  Publication:\rAfter the reviewing, accepted papers will be published via ACM conference proceedings, which will be index by Ei Compendex, Scopus, etc main database.\rConference proceedings for past years have been indexed successfully by EI Compendex and Scopus three months after online.\r  Submission ways:\rThe online submission system is opened at EasyChair here:\rhttps://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=iciea2023europe\r Call for Papers:\rInterested topics including, but not limited to:\r\xe2\x97\x8fAdvanced manufacturing technology and application\r\xe2\x97\x8fManufacturing systems and automation\r\xe2\x97\x8fInformation Industry and Management\rFor more topics, please visit: http://iciea.eu/cfp.html\r Program\rJanuary 09, 2023--Registration,collecting conference materials\rJanuary 10, 2023--Keynote Speech & Presentation Day\rJanuary 11, 2023--Presentation Day (Pending)\r Contact\rDr. Serene Lo\rsecretary_eu@iciea.org\r+1-562-606-1057; +86-13688461344\n\t'

title: b'PEMWN 2022'
description: b'The 11th IFIP/IEEE International Conference on Performance Evaluation and Modeling in Wired and Wireless Networks'
locality: b'UNIVERSITY OF ROMA SAPIENZA, ROMA,  ITAL'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe 11th IFIP/IEEE International Conference on Performance Evaluation and Modeling in Wired and Wireless Networks (PEMWN) is inviting researchers to submit original and unpublished papers pertaining to wired and wireless networks covering novel contributions related to protocols, technologies, architectures, performance evaluation, optimization, simulation and experiments.\r Extended versions of the 3 best papers will be published in "Annals of Telecommunications", Springer\r  https://sites.google.com/view/pemwn2022/home\r IMPORTANT DATES\r -----------------------------\r Submission Deadline (HARD) : July 30, 2022\r Authors Notification: September 7, 2022\r Camera Ready Paper Submission and Registration: September 30, 2022\r Conference Date: November 08-10, 2022\r  MAIN TOPICS OF INTEREST\r-----------------------------------------\r The topics addressed by the conference include, but are not limited to:\r \xc2\xa7  5G and beyond networks\r \xc2\xa7  Cloud computing, Mobile cloud computing\r \xc2\xa7  Cloud continuum, edge and fog computing\r \xc2\xa7  Software Defined Networking (SDN), programmable data planes\r \xc2\xa7  Network Function Virtualization (NFV)\r \xc2\xa7  Radio access networks (RAN), Cloud-RAN, and Fog-RAN\r \xc2\xa7  Software Defined Radio (SDR), Cognitive Radio\r \xc2\xa7  Device-to-Device (D2D) and Machine-to-Machine (M2M) communications\r \xc2\xa7  Unmanned Aerial Vehicles and Internet of drones\r \xc2\xa7  Long-range IoT (LoRa, Sigfox, NB-IoT)\r \xc2\xa7  Low Power Wide Area (LPWA) networks\r \xc2\xa7  Internet of Things (IoT), Internet of Everything (IoE)\r \xc2\xa7  Industry 4.0 and Industrial IoT\r \xc2\xa7  Network Management\r \xc2\xa7  Content Centric Networks (CCN), Information-Centric Networks (ICN)\r \xc2\xa7  Internet of the Future, New IP\r \xc2\xa7  Internet of Vehicles\r \xc2\xa7  Machine learning for IoT and networks\r \xc2\xa7  Smart cities, e-health, and home automation applications\r \xc2\xa7  Cyber-security in wired and wireless communications\r \xc2\xa7  Blockchain applications and technologies\r Authors Instructions\r------------------------------\r Prospective authors should submit original and unpublished papers limited to 6 pages in PDF format. \r Manuscripts should follow IEEE Two-Column format which can be found here:\r http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html\r  All submitted manuscripts will be peer-blind-reviewed by at least three reviewers. \r 12th International Conference on Embedded Systems and Applications (EMSA 2023)

March 18 ~ 19, 2023, Vienna, Austria

Due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, registered authors are now able to present their work through our online platforms.

Scope & Topics

12th International Conference on Embedded Systems and Applications (EMSA 2023)will provide an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology and applications of Embedded Systems. The goal of this Conference is to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to focus on understanding Modern Embedded Systems concepts and establishing new collaborations in these areas.

Authors are solicited to contribute to the conference by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the areas of Computer Science, Engineering and Applications.

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following

  • Application-Specific Processors and Devices\r
  • Business Applications\r
  • Component and Binding Models\r
  • Embedded Computing Education\r
  • Hardware Support\r
  • Embedded Software\r
  • Embedded System and Software\r
  • Embedded System Architecture\r
  • Industrial Practices and Benchmark Suites\r
  • Integration with Business Logic\r
  • Integration with SOA\r
  • Middleware\r
  • Networked Embedded Systems\r
  • Programming Abstractions\r
  • Real-time Systems\r
  • Recent Trends\r
  • Service-Oriented Architectures\r
  • Testing Techniques

Paper Submission

Authors are invited to submit papers through the conference Submission System by October 20, 2022 . Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this conference. The proceedings of the conference will be published by Computer Science Conference Proceedings in Computer Science & Information Technology (CS & IT) series (Confirmed).

Selected papers from EMSA 2023, after further revisions, will be published in the special issue of the following journals.

  • International Journal of Embedded Systems and Applications (IJESA)
  • International Journal of Software Engineering & Applications (IJSEA)- ERA Indexed
  • Computer Science & Engineering: An International Journal (CSEIJ)
  • International Journal of Information Sciences and Techniques (IJIST)
  • Computer Applications: An International Journal (CAIJ)
  • Information Technology in Industry (ITII)

Important Dates

Submission Deadline: October 20, 2022
Authors Notification: December 20, 2022
Final Manuscript Due: December 28, 2022
