Call For Papers: b'\nMagnus Group is ecstatic to invite you to its well-established event \xe2\x80\x9c5th Edition of World Nanotechnology Conference\xe2\x80\x9d (Nanotechnology 2022)\xe2\x80\x9d which will be taking place at online during September 21-22, 2022.\rThe Nanotechnology congress will be held around the theme \xe2\x80\x9cNANO: Neoteric Advancements that Navigate and Outline the next generations.\xe2\x80\x9d\rThis global nano summit will begin by establishing a global platform where passionate researchers, scientists, academicians, educators, nanotechnologists, policymakers, stakeholders, and intellectual scholars will come together for the common goal of identifying challenges and issues in Nanomaterials and Nanotechnology, as well as sustainable methods to address those issues based on their combined research findings. This worldwide nanotechnology congress will give you with a fabulous opportunity to learn more about the latest multidisciplinary approaches in nanoscience and nanotechnology. Furthermore, by offering significant networking time for you to meet top individuals in the area, the conference provides a vital platform for you to make new contacts in the field of nanoscience and nanotechnology. We hope you will find this nanotechnology Conference useful, informative, and enjoyable.\r\n'

title: b'AISC 2022'
description: b'Artificial Intelligence methods for Smart Cities [Elsevier][Scopus][Ei]'
Categories: b'artificial intelligence' b'computer science' b'machine learning' b'pattern recognition'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe main aim of Smart Cities is to improve the daily life of the citizens and supporting their habits by proposing subject-oriented services. In urban scenarios, this improvement is mainly oriented to people and vehicles, which may take advantage from surveillance systems providing services and guaranteeing safe living environments.\r In this context, novel artificial intelligence methods, techniques and systems, particularly those based on Machine/Deep Learning, Computer Vision and Internet of Things, are emerging to solve real-life problems, ranging from video surveillance, road safety and traffic monitoring, prevention of accidents or critical events, to intelligent transportation and management of public services. In fact, AI-based approaches, also leveraging on IoT or cloud networks, may serve as underlying methods to tackle this wide range of problems.\r The Second International Workshop on Artificial Intelligence methods for Smart Cities (AISC 2022) is organized by the Artificial Intelligence and Big Data Laboratory (aibd.unica.it) of the University of Cagliari (Italy), in conjunction with the University of Naples "Federico II" (Italy), as a part of the EUSPN-2022 International Conference to be held in Leuven (Belgium), on October 26-28, 2022.\r ** Submission Guidelines **\r All papers must be original and not simultaneously submitted to another journal or conference. Submitted papers must be formatted according to the guidelines of Procedia Computer Science, MS Word Template, Latex, Template Generic, Elsevier, and must be no longer than 6 pages, including all figures, tables and references.\r Authors are requested to submit their papers electronically using the online conference management system in PDF format before the deadline.\r The submission processes will be managed by easychair.org. If you have used this system before, you can use the same username and password. If this is your first time using EasyChair, you will need to register for an account by clicking \xe2\x80\x9cI have no EasyChair account\xe2\x80\x9d button. Upon completion of registration, you will get a notification email from the system and you are ready for submitting your paper. You can upload and re-upload the paper to the system by the submission due date.\r The objective of AISC 2022 is to solicit and publish the latest advances and ideas, based on Machine/Deep Learning, heuristics and/or Computer Vision techniques, on topics which include, but are not limited to, the following:\r * Artificial Intelligence methods for Smart Cities;\r* Anomalies detection;\r* People/objects detection;\r* Fight recognition;\r* Gait analysis in uncontrolled scenarios;\r* Dangerous pedestrian crossing;\r* Background/Foreground segmentation in urban scenarios;\r* Vehicle/drone tracking;\r* Video-surveillance in Smart Cities;\r* Crowd analysis;\r* Lane Detection/Segmentation;\r* Traffic light management;\r* Smart Cities databases;\r* Car reidentification;\r* License Plate recognition;\r* Object Trajectory estimation/prediction;\r* Cloud-based approaches for traffic management;\r* IoT networks in Smart Cities;\r* Biometric identification;\r* Intelligent transportation systems.\r To submit a paper to AISC 2022, please go to the dedicated submission page (http://aibd.unica.it/aisc/submission.php).\r ** Important dates **\r * Paper submission deadline: ** July 31, 2022 ** (extended!)\r* Notification to authors: August 10, 2022\r* Camera-ready submission deadline: September 1, 2022 (firm!)\r* Workshop: October 26-28, 2022\r ** Publication **\r All AISC 2022 accepted papers will be included in the official EUSPN-2022 proceedings, published by Elsevier Science, in the open-access Procedia Computer Science series online. Procedia Computer Science is hosted by Elsevier (elsevier.com) and on Elsevier content platform ScienceDirect (sciencedirect.com), and will be freely available worldwide.\r All papers in Procedia will be indexed by Scopus, Google Scholar, Thomson Reuters\' Conference Proceeding Citation Index, EI Compendex, and DBLP. The papers will contain linked references, XML versions and citable DOI numbers. You will be able to provide a hyperlink to all delegates and direct your conference website visitors to your proceedings.\r Highly relevant papers will be selected to submit an extension of their work in EUSPN-2021 and AISC 2022 dedicated Special Issues in top-tier international journals.\r ** Venue **\r The AISC 2022 workshop will be held in conjunction with the 13th International Conference on Emerging Ubiquitous Systems and Pervasive Networks (EUSPN-2022), in Leuven, Belgium on October 26-28, 2022. More details available on the EUSPN-2021 website (http://cs-conferences.acadiau.ca/euspn-22/).\r The presentation of the accepted papers is going to be ONSITE.\r ** Contact **\r All questions about submissions should be emailed to the workshop Chairs:\r Sebastian Podda: sebastianpodda [at] unica.it\rLivio Pompianu: pompianu.livio [at] unica.it\rSalvatore Carta: salvatore [at] unica.it\rSilvio Barra: silvio.barra [at] unina.it\n\t'

title: b'AUSDM 2022'
description: b'THE 20TH AUSTRALASIAN DATA MINING CONFERENCE 2022'
Categories: b'data mining'
Call For Papers: b'\nAUSDM 2022 First Call for Papers\r  AusDM Festival: Marking the 20th Anniversary of the Australasian Data Mining Conference (AusDM 2022)\rWestern Sydney, Australia, 12 - 16 December 2022\rhttps://ausdm22.ausdm.org\r  -------------------\rImportant Dates\r-------------------\rAbstract submission: 5 Aug 22\rPaper submission: 12 Aug 22\rNoti\xef\xac\x81cation: 23 Sept 22\rCamera-ready: 7 Oct 22\rAuthor Registration: 7 Oct 22\rConference: 12-16 Dec 22\r  -------------\rDescription\r-------------\rThe conference is planned to be an in-person event in western Sydney. Participants from Australia and New Zealand are encouraged to attend it personally. There will be an option for overseas participants to attend it virtually.\r  The Australasian Data Mining Conference has established itself as the premier Australasian meeting for both practitioners and researchers in data mining. It is devoted to the art and science of intelligent analysis of (usually big) data sets for meaningful (and previously unknown) insights. This conference will enable the sharing and learning of research and progress in the local context and breakthroughs in data mining algorithms and their applications across all industries.\r  Since AusDM\xe2\x80\x9902, the conference has showcased research in data mining, providing a forum for presenting and discussing the latest research and developments. Built on this tradition, AusDM\xe2\x80\x9922 will facilitate the cross-disciplinary exchange of ideas, experience and potential research directions. Speci\xef\xac\x81cally, the conference seeks to showcase: Research Prototypes; Industry Case Studies; Practical Analytics Technology; and Research Student Projects. AusDM\xe2\x80\x9922 will be a meeting place for pushing forward the frontiers of data mining in academia and industry.\r  AusDM\xe2\x80\x9922 will deliver keynote speeches, invited talks, full paper presentations, abstract, posters, tutorials, workshops, social events, etc.\r  -------------------------\rPublication and Topics\r-------------------------\rWe are calling for papers, both research and applications, and from both academia and industry, for publication and presentation at the conference. All papers will go through double-blind, peer\xe2\x80\x93review by a panel of international experts. The AusDM 2022 proceeding will be published by Springer Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) and become available immediately after the conference.\r  Please note that AusDM\xe2\x80\x9922 requires that at least one author for each accepted paper register for the conference and present their work for the paper to be published in the proceeding.\r  AusDM\xe2\x80\x9922 invites contributions addressing current research in data mining and knowledge discovery as well as experiences, novel applications and future challenges. Topics of interest include, but are not restricted to:\r  Applications and Case Studies\rBig Data Analytics\rBiomedical and Health Data Mining\rData mining techniques in Neuroinformatics\rData Mining in Genomics and Proteomics\rBusiness Analytics\rComputational Aspects of Data Mining\rData Integration, Matching and Linkage\rData Mining in Education\rData Mining in Security and Surveillance\rData Preparation, Cleaning and Preprocessing\rData Stream Mining\rDeep Learning\rEvaluation of Results and their Communication\r  ---------------------\rKeynote Speakers\r---------------------\rAs is tradition for AusDM we have lined up an excellent keynote speaker program. Each speaker is a well-known researcher and/or practitioner in data mining and related disciplines. The keynote program provides an opportunity to hear from some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s leaders on what the technology o\xef\xac\x80ers and where it is heading.\r  --------------\rSubmissions\r--------------\rWe invite three types of submissions for AusDM\xe2\x80\x9922:\r  Research Track: Academic submissions reporting on new algorithms, novel approaches and research progress, with a paper length of between 8 and 15 pages in Springer CCIS style, as detailed below.\r  Application Track: Submissions reporting on applications of data mining and machine learning and describing speci\xef\xac\x81c data mining implementations and experiences in the real world. Submissions in this category can be between 6 and 15 pages in Springer CCIS style, as detailed below.\r  Industry Showcase Track: Submissions from governments and industry on an analytics solution that has raised profits, reduced costs and/or achieved other important policy and/or business outcomes can be made in this track. Submissions to this category should be a 1-page extended abstract. Note that this track is presentation only, without publication in conference proceedings. For publication of your papers, please submit them to the above Application Track.\r  All submissions, except for the Industry Showcase Track, will go through a double-blind review process, i.e. paper submissions must NOT include authors names or affiliations or acknowledgments referring to funding bodies. Self-citing references should also be removed from the submitted papers for the double-blinded reviewing purpose. The information can be added in the accepted final camera-ready submissions.\r  All submissions are required to follow the format specified for papers in the Springer Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) style. Authors should consult Springer\xe2\x80\x99s authors\xe2\x80\x99 guidelines and use the proceeding templates, either in LaTeX or Word, for the preparation of their papers. The electronic submission must be in PDF only and made through the AusDM Submission page. Springer encourages authors to include their ORCIDs in their papers. In addition, the corresponding author of each paper, acting on behalf of all the authors of the paper, must complete and sign a Consent to Publish form, through which the copyright for their paper is transferred to Springer.\r  -------------------------\rOrganizing Committee\r-------------------------\r Steering Committee Chairs\rSimeon Simoff (Western Sydney University)\rGraham Williams (The Australian National University)\r  General Chairs\rYun Sing Koh (University of Auckland)\rYanchang Zhao (Data61, CSIRO)\r  PC Chair \xe2\x80\x93 Research\rHeitor Murilo Gomes (Victoria University of Wellington)\rLaurence Park (Western Sydney University)\r  PC Chair \xe2\x80\x93 Application\rMaryam Doborjeh (Auckland University of Technology)\r  Industry Chair\rJess Moore (The Australian National University)\r  Special Session Chair\rDiana Benavides Prado (University of Auckland)\r  Publication Chair\rYee Ling Boo (Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology)\r  Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Chair\rRichi Nayak (Queensland University of Technology)\r  Finance Chair\rMichael Walsh (Western Sydney University)\r  Web Chair\rBen Halstead (University of Auckland)\r  Publicity Chair\rMonica Bian (University of Sydney)\r  Local Organising Chair\rMadhushi Bandara (University of Technology Sydney)\r  ----------------------\rFurther Information\r----------------------\r  AusDM\xe2\x80\x9922 website: https://ausdm22.ausdm.org\rContact: ausdm22@ausdm.org\rTwitter: https://twitter.com/AusDm2022\rLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/4907891/ \rFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/ausdm2022conference\n\t'
